title: Edge Count
content: The number of edges in a simple graph, computed as the cardinality of the edge finset.

title: No Isolated Vertices
content: Every vertex has at least one neighbor. Required in the problem to avoid trivial cases.

title: Edge Coloring
content: A 2-coloring of K_n represented as a function from vertex pairs to Bool.

title: Valid Coloring
content: A coloring is valid if symmetric (c(i,j) = c(j,i)) and irreflexive (c(i,i) = false).

title: Monochromatic Clique
content: A set S forms a monochromatic clique if all edges within S have the same color.

title: Ramsey Number R(k)
content: The minimum n such that any 2-coloring of K_n contains a monochromatic K_k.

title: Ramsey Number R(G)
content: For general graph G: minimum n such that any 2-coloring of K_n contains a monochromatic copy of G.

title: Edge Decomposition
content: Given m edges, find n and t such that m = C(n,2) + t with 0 ≤ t < n.

title: Maximally Complete Graph
content: K_n plus a new vertex connected to t vertices. This is conjectured to maximize R(G) for m edges.

title: Erdős-Graham Conjecture
content: For any G with m edges, R(G) ≤ R(H) where H is the maximally complete graph.

title: Small Counterexamples
content: The set {2,3,4,5,7,8,9} where the conjecture is known to fail.

title: Counterexamples Exist
content: For each m in the small counterexamples set, there exists a graph with R(G) > R(H).

title: Asymptotic Conjecture
content: The conjecture may hold for sufficiently large m. This remains open.

title: Sudakov's Upper Bound
content: R(G) ≤ 2^{C√m} for any graph G with m edges. Proven in 2011.

title: R(3) = 6
content: The classic result: any 2-coloring of K_6 contains a monochromatic triangle.

title: R(4) = 18
content: Any 2-coloring of K_18 contains a monochromatic K_4.

title: Edge Monotonicity
content: If G is a subgraph of H, then R(G) ≤ R(H). More edges means harder to avoid.
